sections.heading: cocotbext-fcov
sections.text: Cocotb Extension for Functional Coverage Closure

children.heading: Installation
children.text:
$ git clone https://github.com/furiosa-ai/cocotbext-fcov
$ pip install ./cocotbext-fcov

children.heading: CoverPoint
children.text:
The
CoverPoint
class defines specific ranges to be covered during verification using bins, corresponding to the
coverpoint
in SystemVerilog.
CoverPoint
requires a collection of bins, and the following types are supported as bins:

children.heading: integer
range
children.text:
CoverPoint
([
range
(
10
),
range
(
10
,
20
)])
# bins bin_0_9 = {[0:9]};
# bins bin_10_19 = {[10:19]};

children.heading: Predefined Bin Types
children.text: For convenience, some predefined bin types are provided:

children.heading: BinSingle
children.text:
CoverPoint
(
BinSingle
(
1
))
# bins bin_1 = {1};
CoverPoint
(
BinSingle
(
range
(
10
)))
# bins bin_0_9 = {[0:9]};

children.heading: BinUniform
children.text:
Use like python
range()
CoverPoint
(
BinUniform
(
10
))
# bins bin_0_9[] = {[0:9]};
CoverPoint
(
BinUniform
(
10
,
20
,
num
=
5
))
# bins bin_10_19[5] = {[10:19]};

children.heading: BinRange
children.text:
Same as
BinUniform
, but not support
num
argument
CoverPoint
(
BinRange
(
10
))
# bins bin_0_9[] = {[0:9]};
CoverPoint
(
BinRange
(
10
,
20
))
# bins bin_10_19[] = {[10:19]};

children.heading: BinDict
children.text:
CoverPoint
(
BinDict
({
"FALSE"
:
0
,
"TRUE"
:
1
}),
format
=
"b"
)
# bins FALSE = {'b0};
# bins TRUE = {'b1};

children.heading: BinEnum
children.text:
class
Bool
(
Enum
):
FALSE
=
0
TRUE
=
1
CoverPoint
(
BinEnum
(
Bool
),
format
=
"b"
)
# bins FALSE = {'b0};
# bins TRUE = {'b1};

children.heading: BinBool
BinExp
children.text:
Use like python
range()
CoverPoint
(
BinExp
(
100
,
base
=
10
))
# bins bin_0 = {0}
# bins bin_1_9 = {[1:9]}
# bins bin_10_99 = {[10:99]}

children.heading: BinBitwise
children.text:

BinBitwise

3

name

children.heading: Cross
children.text:
The
Cross
class supports the examination of various combinations of values of coverpoints, corresponding to the
cross
in SystemVerilog.
Cross
([
cp1
,
cp2
],
name
=
"cx"
)
# cx: cross cp1, cp2;

children.heading: CoverGroup
children.text:
The
CoverGroup
class is a container that groups together multiple coverpoints and samples covered values, corresponding to the
covergroup
in SystemVerilog.
class
CustomCoverGroup
(
CoverGroup
):
cp_bool
=
CoverPoint
(
BinBool
())
cp_range
=
CoverPoint
(
BinRange
(
10
))
cx_bool_range
=
Cross
([
cp_bool
,
cp_range
])
cg_custom
=
CustomCoverGroup
(
name
=
"cg_custom"
)
# covergroup cg_custom;
#   cp_bool: coverpoint cg_custom_cp_bool {
#     bins FALSE = {0};
#     bins TRUE = {1};
#   }
#   cp_range: coverpoint cg_custom_cp_range {
#     bins bin_0_9 = {[0:9]};
#   }
#   cx_bool_range: cross cp_bool, cp_range;

children.heading: CoverageModel
children.text:
A
CoverageModel
is a collection of specifications used to measure the coverage of a design during simulation, typically represented by a set of CoverGroups and coverted to a single module in SystemVerilog.
class
CustomCovModel
(
CoverageModel
):
cg_custom_1
=
CustomCoverGroup1
()
cg_custom_2
=
CustomCoverGroup2
()
cov_model
=
CustomCovModel
()
# module cov_model();
#   wire ...
#   covergroup cg_custom_1 ...
#   wire ...
#   covergroup cg_custom_2 ...
# endmodule

children.heading: make_coverage
children.text:
A tool that generates SystemVerilog code and Markdown documentation from Python code, including model instances.
Usage:
make_coverage [-h] [--file FILE] [--sv_output SV_OUTPUT] [--md_output MD_OUTPUT] [--overwrite]
Optional arguments:
-h, --help            show this help message and exit
  --file FILE, -f FILE  python files that include coverage model instances
  --sv_output SV_OUTPUT, -sv SV_OUTPUT
                        output file name for systemverilog code
  --md_output MD_OUTPUT, -md MD_OUTPUT
                        output file name for markdown document
  --overwrite, -w       force overwrite output files if they exist

children.heading: CoverageCollector
children.text: A base class designed to gather and sample coverage values using coverage models.
